unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Braces for Box Office Dhamaka!**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Braces for Box Office Dhamaka!**

unnormalised: Bollywood is holding its breath (and probably sipping chai) as a trio of much-anticipated movies gear up for release this Diwali season. Get ready for a clash of the titans that might just rival the Mahabharata, but with more song and dance.
normalised: Bollywood is holding its breath (and probably sipping chai) as a trio of much anticipated movies gear up for release this Diwali season. Get ready for a clash of the titans that might just rival the Mahabharata, but with more song and dance.

unnormalised: First up, we have "Desi Avengers," hitting screens on 25/10/2024 at 10:30 hrs. Early reviews suggest it's got more VFX than a Rajinikanth film. Then, "Sharmaji Goes to Space," a heartwarming tale of a middle-class Delhi uncle who accidentally joins a space mission. It promises zero gravity shenanigans from 01/11/2024.
normalised: First up, we have "Desi Avengers," hitting screens on twenty fifth october two thousand and twenty four at ten thirty hours. Early reviews suggest it has more V F X than a Rajinikanth film. Then, "Sharmaji Goes to Space," a heartwarming tale of a middle class Delhi uncle who accidentally joins a space mission. It promises zero gravity shenanigans from first november two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! On 08/11/2024, prepare for "Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Kebab," a family drama so dramatic, your nanima might faint. Word on the street (and by street, we mean Filmistan Studio Lane) is that the film features a wedding sequence longer than the Mumbai-Pune Expressway (149 km, give or take). Experts predict a Rs. 300 Crore opening weekend. May the best film win...or at least generate the most memes.
normalised: But wait, there is more! On eighth november two thousand and twenty four, prepare for "Kabhi Khushi Kabhi Kebab," a family drama so dramatic, your nanima might faint. Word on the street (and by street, we mean Filmistan Studio Lane) is that the film features a wedding sequence longer than the Mumbai-Pune Expressway (one hundred and forty nine kilometer, give or take). Experts predict a rupee three hundred crore opening weekend. May the best film win...or at least generate the most memes.
